org.wonderly.threads
Class ForeverThread

java.lang.Object
  org.wonderly.threads.ForeverThread
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public abstract class ForeverThread
extends Object
implements Runnable

This abstract class provides a foundation for Threads that need to run 'forever'. Subclasses should Implement process() to perform the task that should always be active. If code inside of process() throws an exception (e.g. IOException or SocketException) either handle it, or close all sockets and/or I/O streams and let the main loop reinvoke process() and the code there can just start over. 


new Thread( new ForeverThread() {
        public void process() throws IOException {
                Socket s = new Socket( "remotehost", reportport );
                try {
                        BufferedReader rd = s.getInputStream();
                        String line;
                        while( (line = rd.readLine()) != null) {
                                processLine( line );
                        }
                } finally {
                        s.close();
                }
        }
        public void reportException( Throwable ex ) {
                ex.printStackTrace();
        }
}, "MyProcessingThread").start(); 

...

public void processLine( String line ) {
        ... do something with lines read from socket ...
}

Author:
Gregg Wonderly.

Specified by:
run in interface Runnable

setErrorSleep

public void setErrorSleep(long millis)
Sets the time to delay between calls to process if process returns for any reason. This will allow socket problems or other non-permanent error conditions to be continously probed, looking for the time to start processing again.

process

public abstract void process()
                      throws Exception
Implement this method, watching stopping for any loops or long term operations. The lock should be used for sleeps via lock.wait() so that the thread will be woke when it is time to stop

Throws:
Exception

reportException

public abstract void reportException(Throwable ex)
An exceptions that occur will be reported via this method.
